Call Out by Mr. Dennis for August 21, 2020
We have completed the second week of the 2020-2021 school year and enrollment numbers have continued to increase. This week‚Äôs enrollment increased to 11,110 students. From a health perspective, there were fewer positive COVID-19 tests; two teachers tested positive for COVID-19 and six students. Also, students and employees that tested positive earlier in August have now recovered, cleared health checks, and are returning to schools. Please, monitor the people that your children come into contact with away from school, specifically, those that are symptomatic or have tested positive for COVID-19. Also, continue to screen your children before they report to school and self-isolate if anyone in the household is symptomatic. Next Monday, the Alabama Department Public Health will host a WebEx which may require changes to the current COVID-19 flow chart on meeting requirements and recommendations. Elmore County will make any necessary changes immediately.
The Governor‚Äôs Alabama Broadband Connectivity for Students Program will help fund and deliver free internet access to eligible K-12 students in their homes this fall. The letter from the State of Alabama you will receive serves as a prepaid voucher from the ABC for Students Program and covers the cost of equipment, installation, and high-speed internet service through December 30, 2020. The voucher can be used once, with one internet service provider, to sign up for service for the duration of the program. Enrolled households will not receive any bills and will not be charged any additional fees by the internet service provider. Please make sure to complete the Child Nutrition Program Lunch Application on the school‚Äôs or Elmore County website to be eligible for the free internet access.
This week, extracurricular activities have begun with restrictions in attendance and requirements for masks to be worn and social distancing. Please check your child‚Äôs school website for specific information. Also, base school virtual program registration will now be done only through the base schools. If you wish to register your child for the base school virtual program, contact the administration at the school for details. If your student switches between school-based virtual school and traditional school multiple times, the administration will intervene and require the parent to make a choice for the semester. Please take this into account as you make decisions for your student.
We will continue to adapt to the COVID-19 impact on schools and communities to do our best to make schools safe and provide students an opportunity to learn and engage in as many programs as possible.
Thank you for your support and have a great day.
Every Student Empowered, Every Student Succeeds.
Richard Dennis

The Alabama Broadband Connectivity for Students Program (ABC for Students Program):
Governor Kay Ivey has committed $100 million in Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act funding to deliver free internet access to eligible K-12 students in their homes this fall. The State of Alabama is using the funds to purchase internet service for low-income households with K-12 students so students can participate in distance learning. This service is being administered through the Alabama Broadband Connectivity for Students Program.

Students in Alabama that are enrolled in the National School Lunch Program through their school are automatically eligible for the Alabama Broadband Connectivity for Students Program (ABC for Students Program). The letter you will receive serves as a prepaid voucher from the ABC for Students Program and covers the cost of equipment, installation, and high-speed internet service through December 30, 2020. The voucher can be used once, with one internet service provider, to sign up for service for the duration of the program. Enrolled households will not receive any bills and will not be charged any additional fees by the internet service provider.

Richard Dennis, Superintendent of Elmore County Public Schools conducted a call out today, August 14, 2020, and this is the script of that call.

As we finish the first week of school in Elmore County, I want to share information about our experiences and the areas we want to improve.
As of today, Friday, August 14, 10,932, students have enrolled and returned to active participation in our system. Of this total, 6,358 students are attending traditional schools, 4,329 students are participating in the school-based virtual program, and 245 students are attending The EDGE. We expect to continue enrolling students each week and find the appropriate placement for them.
As we prepare for the second week of school and the start of extracurricular activity events that will include spectators, we want to ask that everyone please, consult their child's school website for specific details, guidelines, and requirements covering the events on each campus. There will be COVID-19 health requirements to meet ECBOE Policies and Procedures, ADPH, and current Alabama Mandates. Specifically, masks are required at all events.
The new normal in school is to follow the safe practices to monitor and react to potential COVID-19 cases on our campuses.
First, parents, screen your child before he/she attends school. Check for any fever and any of the following symptoms: fever and chills, fatigue, shortness of breath, cough, headaches, and new loss of taste and/or smell.
Second, self-isolate your child and notify the school's administration if you or anyone in your household come in contact with someone that has tested positive for COVID-19 or is showing signs or symptoms.
Thirdly, if the school nurse contacts you due to your child not feeling well, please, have someone available to pick up the child as soon as possible.
Fourth, face shields can be used instead of masks.
Since the end of last week, seven students have tested positive for COVID-19. These students will be quarantined for a minimum of 10 days to meet ADPH Guidelines. An additional 65 students are self-isolated for 14 days due to direct contact with an individual that has tested positive for COVID-19 or were symptomatic. This includes contact with family members that have tested positive as well.
Since August 4, 7 employees have tested positive, and 29 others have been self-isolated due to being symptomatic or direct contact with a person that has tested positive for COVID-19.
Elmore County will continue to monitor and adhere to ADPH Guidelines and recommendations. We ask that you please communicate any health issues to the local school administration or nurse.
This will be an on-going process that everyone must work together to improve. It isn't easy having to self-isolate a student or employee for 14 days; however, it is part of the ADPH Guidelines and will help to prevent the unnecessary spread of COVID-19. Be reminded that students can continue with their classes while at home using the virtual platform and maintain attendance requirements based on VE-Virtual Engagement.
Please, communicate with your local school on any health issues as we continue to navigate the new normal.

Thank you,
Every Student Empowered, Every Student Succeeds.

Richard Dennis

Elmore County Public Schools - Call Out for August 6, 2020
This is Richard Dennis, superintendent of Elmore County Public Schools. As we prepare to open schools on August 10, I want to update you on the most current mandates and requirements. The Elmore County Public Schools website is www.elmoreco.com. You may access most Opening of Schools information through the Elmore County Parent Academy link found on the home page along with a Frequently Asked Questions document that will continue to be updated as requirements, mandates, and information changes.
Currently, the Governor has mandated face masks that cover the mouth and nose for employees and all students from 2nd grade through 12th grade. This is required in Elmore County Schools and will remain in effect until further notice. If and when the mandate is lifted, I will consult with the Elmore County Board and recommend a change based on the current sustained Elmore County health status rating from the Alabama Department of Public Health. If your child is in 2nd through 12th grade and cannot wear a face mask, please consider using your child‚Äôs base school‚Äôs virtual program.
Each Elmore County school has a virtual platform and you may register for it on the school‚Äôs or the Elmore County website. The EDGE is a separate 3rd through 12th grade school and requires a student to transfer from his/her current school to attend. If a student starts the year in EDGE he/she will not be allowed to transfer back to the local base school until the end of the first nine weeks. Please consult the local principal if you have questions.
Parents and guardians are asked to screen your child/children daily before sending them to school. If they have a temperature of 100 degrees or higher or exhibit any symptoms that indicate they are not well, please do not send them to school. Elmore County has adopted a blended attendance policy, so students that are sick or have approved absences from school may continue to work on a virtual platform. If the student meets the requirements outlined in the Elmore County Student Handbook posted on the Elmore County website, the student will be counted VE-present ‚Äì Virtual Engagement. If students arrive at school and are exhibiting health issues or they are determined to be sick, they will be isolated and socially distanced from others and the parent/guardian will be contacted to pick them up from school.
It is our goal to provide the safest possible environment for all students and employees. To do so we must all cooperate and adhere to proper health guidelines. A student or employee who is exposed to the COVID-19 virus and has not maintained the proper health requirements may be asked to self-isolate for 14 days. Elmore County will work to communicate and train all personnel and students on these guidelines.
I understand your concerns as you decide whether your child or children will return to traditional school or virtual school. Please review the 2020 Reopening of Elmore County Schools and Frequently Asked Questions documents for more information.
This will be a very different start to a school year, and we will continue to monitor and respond to the necessary changes. Please be safe as we begin the 2020 2021 school year.
Thank you,
Every Student Empowered, Every Student Succeeds.
Richard Dennis

Explanation of our Virtual School Options:

Base School Virtual Option (this is the virtual option through the base school and will be monitored by a certified teacher at the local school)

Each Elmore County Public School has access to a grade-appropriate virtual platform/software.
a. Kindergarten ‚Äì 5th grade will use Odysseyware.
b. 6th ‚Äì 12th grades will use Edgenuity.
c. Students that are concerned about returning to school during the COVID-19 crisis may temporarily participate at the base school in these platforms full-time until the pandemic status ends.
d. The base school will manage all aspects of the virtual students that are enrolled with them in this fashion. That means that they will need to have a teacher assigned to instruct, monitor, and supervise as the teacher of record.
e. This is the same process used this past spring, the only exception being not all students will be virtual.

The exception to this policy: AHSAA guidelines require that a virtual student be enrolled at the base school. AHSAA qualified athletes may be instructed through EDGE and participate in required on-campus activities and remain on the base school roll.

The Virtual School - EDGE (this is not through the base school)-

Students that intend to enroll in a virtual school and understand that this does not run through the base school, and are in grades 3 -12, should enroll in the EDGE.
a. The EDGE is an individual, stand-alone school.
b. If a student that currently attends a traditional school, e.g. HHS, chooses to transfer to EDGE, he/she will literally be transferred to a new school.

All High Schools:
ACCESS courses are still available for each high school as needed if the administration chooses to offer them.

How to enroll in Spectrum Internet Assist
Spectrum has set up a web page dedicated to enrolling qualified families and individuals in its Internet Assist program.

Website: charter.com/browse/content/spectrum-internet-assist
Telephone: 844-525-1574

ALABAMA (FORMERLY BRIGHT HOUSE) ‚Äì Elmore County Spectrum Internet Assist: Low-income families and seniors can get unlimited high-speed internet for just $17.99 per month

Sure, $17.99 is $5 per month more than Comcast‚Äôs Internet Essential and CenturyLink‚Äôs Internet Basics, but Spectrum customers will get extra speed for those extra dollars ‚Äî speeds of up to 30 Mbps downstream and 4 Mbps upstream.

Even better, Spectrum has eliminated all data caps on this new plan. That means you can use all the internet you want ‚Äî all your kids can do all their homework, all the Internet they need to download every video they need to succeed in school, and all the Internet your family needs to download films. All without any fear of running out of allowable gigabytes.

EDITOR‚ÄôS NOTE: The $17.99 offer gives you wired service, but Spectrum offers a wi-fi router for $5 per month. We recommend that you simply purchase your own wi-fi router from amazon.com or RadioShack or any other electronics retailer. They‚Äôre easy to set up and it will save you $5 per month.

Are you eligible?
The Spectrum program is aimed at two important groups:

Families with students who participate in the National School Lunch Program, and Seniors 65 and older who receive Supplemental Security Income. That makes it the first program specifically aimed at seniors who so desperately need a low-income Internet plan for which they can qualify.

Qualified applicants will receive a free modem and a self-installation kit that makes the whole process simple.

NOTE: Qualified subscribers will also be eligible to receive Spectrum‚Äôs phone service bundle offers. That means you could get this low-cost, high-speed Internet service plus home telephone service in one money-saving package (for example, Spectrum‚Äôs ‚ÄúTriple Play‚Äù bundle would give you Spectrum Internet Assist/home telephone/cable TV starting at $74.97 per month).

Please keep one thing in mind: You will not qualify if you have had a Charter or Time-Warner broadband subscription within 60 days of enrolling or any outstanding bills with any of the three companies, you will to pay it off before enrolling.

Economic Authority (ECEDA), our municipalities, and Central Access announce the release of an interactive map of public broadband hotspots available in the county. With the assistance of Central Access, additional public hotspot locations that are soon to be available are also included on the map.

Currently, there are 63 public hotspots available throughout the county between Central Access, Spectrum, municipal, ECBOE and other community sites. Plans are in place to increase the public hotspot opportunities to close to 100 sites over the next several months. To view the available and future public hotspots, the partnership has developed a digital map hosted on the Elmore County Commission website.

As additional public hotspots come online, the map will be updated so citizens have access to the most current set of active and available sites.

The map is available on the Elmore County Commission website at https://elmorecounty.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=3bae3df6f3864cafbf28a01cf01cee70

Mr. Jeff Glass and The Wetumpka High Theatre Guild's Student Presentation Team, comprised of Jashay Kendrick, Grayson Isabella Singleton, Stanton Yarboro, Caroline Macon, Morgan Causey, Searcey Herring, Brody Valdakis and Tanner Caton, gave a presentation to the Elmore County Board of Education today. They provided information about our students and our program, how our group is growing, the direction we are going and the great need of financial and moral support that we require from the BOE and our community. We are so proud of this group and all of their accomplishments! Thank you to the Board of Education for your enthusiasm and encouragement!
